intro: Gochnatia laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Gochnatia laxiflora is often found in regions with a Mediterranean climate, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
